fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33837].
  {panel}

According to our documentation on [Deleting users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Deletingauser]:

{quote}
To delete a user:

    Locate the user in the User browser (see Viewing Users above) and click the Delete link in the Operations column.
    The confirmation screen that follows will summarise any involvement of that user in the system by showing current issues assigned to and reported by that user, etc. These connections between the user and other parts of the system may prevent the deletion of that user. 
    Take any actions required to disassociate the user with JIRA. These may include:
        Reassigning any issues assigned to the user.
        Bulk-editing the issues created by the user and change the 'Reporter' to someone else. You'll need the 'Modify Reporter' permission to do this. You will also need to allow editing of closed issues if some of the issues the user created are closed and you do not wish to reopen them.
        Changing the owner of shared dashboards owned by the user. See Managing Shared Dashboards.
        Changing the project lead for any projects that the user is a lead of.
    If there are no issues assigned to, or reported by the user, the confirmation screen will display a Delete button; click this to proceed with the deletion.

Please Note:

    The filters and dashboards of a user will be deleted when the user is deleted, regardless of whether the filters or dashboards are shared with other users.
    Any numbers of issues which have been reported by or assigned to the user you are attempting to delete, are respectively hyperlinked to a list of the individual issues (in the Issue Navigator).
{quote}

However, if a user made comments to issues, it cannot be deleted. JIRA will display the following message:

{quote}
Cannot delete user 'xxx has associations in JIRA that cannot be removed automatically.

Change the following and try again:

* Issue Comments: 10
{quote}

This needs to be included in the documentation.
fields.summary: Edit the documentation on Deleting Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33829].
  {panel}

There is an odd behavior when a user tries to modify the workflow arrows (in the *Diagram*) mode, and position them to the edge of the status. It seems that when he goes out of the *Diagram* mode to the *Text* mode, and then comes back again to the *Diagram* mode, those arrows' modifications will be reset to the default arrow position.

h4.Steps to produce:
# Go to (_Issues > Workflows_)
# Choose a workflow and edit it in the *Diagram* mode
# Try positioning the arrows to the end of the statuses
# Go to the *Text* mode of the workflow and then go back again to the *Diagram* mode

You will notice that the arrow was back to the default position.

It will be nice, if the arrow remains in the same position, instead of resetting back to the default position.
fields.summary: Workflow arrows' position resets

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33828].
  {panel}

Provide the ability to associate one or more groups or individuals that identify valid users for a custom user field. 
For example, I create a custom field that we want to associate a QA to; however, I only want users who are in the QA group to be able to be selected vs being able to associate any user. 
When setting up the custom field, I can identify which groups and/or individuals that identify the list of valid users for that field. 

This helps control data integrity and ensures the right people are communicated to, without delay, since I can already create a notification for anyone associated with such a field

It would be useful to create an association of sub-task types with a given parent-task type.

I've create a risk register system, whereby I have an issue type of "Risk" and a sub-task of associated treatments of types "Treatment"

I would like to be able to associate the "Treatment" type with "Risk" so only sub-type issues of that type can be create to "Treatment", but "Sub-task" can still be made for existing issues.

This would prevent the user from having to make a decision about which type of issue should be created.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33806].
  {panel}

We've created an issue custom field called "Departments" by which many of our dashboard gadgets are sorted on.  If the field is left empty at issue creation or update, the Pie Chart will show a "None" portion which is perfect.  But if we want to see the details of the issues left blank on the custom field, the related filter shows an empty issue list.  It seems like the "EMPTY" key word is not working properly in the query.  Here is the query example:

filter = HKN_ALL_Unresolved_Not_Waiting_Approval AND project = HKNFAT AND "HKN Department" is EMPTY

In this example, the Pie Chart shows 2 issues with "none" as HKN Department, but the query returns 0 issues.

Please help.
Thank you.
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget data does not show in related filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33805].
  {panel}

* We need to be able to allow our customers to email support requests into our Jira install.
* We cannot create users automatically when someone not already set up in Jira emails a support request in. I understand that in that case, we have to set up a dummy account, and set the "reporterusername" to that dummy account, so that the dummy account can create the ticket on behalf of the customer who mailed in the support request.

Now, here is our problem. In this scenario, the customer, the person who sent in the email requesting support, never gets a confirmation email from the system that their request was received. They never get automatic emails from Jira informing them of comments or progress to their request, and they never get an automatic email from Jira telling them when their request is completed or closed.

I see that the original customer's email address is appended to the issue description field, and that our customer support personel can copy that address and manually create email updates to keep the customer informed, but for us, that creates additional workflow issues and potential for omissions that are not acceptable to us. Is there any way to have Jira email the customer who sent in the ticket automatically when the ticket is created, updated and closed, given our environment?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33788].
  {panel}

Tested in JIRA 5.2.7
Affected system fields: Assignee and Reporter

When using the usernames to search under the 'Suggested Users' list, user will not able to find users by typing the username, but if they type in the Full Name, the user appears. 

As an example, I have a user with:
** Username: checking
** Full Name: name
* We can see that the user is under the suggested users list:
!1.PNG|thumbnail!
* When I type 'name' the user appears. Shown as:
!2.PNG|thumbnail!
* When I type 'checking' it returns no match. (Because this user is under the suggested list)
!3.PNG|thumbnail!

However, this seems to be improved inside JIRA 6.0.x. In JIRA 6, you can search the user by both username or Full Name, even the user is under the suggested list.
fields.summary: Basic search in Issue Navigator can't find by username to autocomplete in Assginee and Reporter field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33783].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Currently, JIRA BTF cannot link to a Confluence page using [Confluence Page Title]. As this feature is available for OnDemand, we shall have this feature in BTF as well. 

We can only link to a Confluence page using [Issue Linking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage]

In both OnDemand and BTF, the settings are as below:
* Application link is configured
* Project link to Confluence Space is configured

h5. Screencast
For OnDemand: http://screencast.com/t/sL9S8Cmmk
For BTF: http://screencast.com/t/7fWdfgfffz9G

h5. Workaround
User can link to a Confluence page using this notation
{code}
[Confluence Page|<link to Confluence page>]
{code}
fields.summary: Link to a Confluence Page using notation

"See comment #12 ..." and so on. Right now it is *not* clear at all without counting the comments yourself or adding those weird links to a comment.

You could take a look at Bugzilla for example. It has comments IDs and those are easily accessible through links like: http://somehost.org/<bugid>#c<commentid> so http://somehost.org/1337#c1

fields.description: We have a group of issues over 2 projects, for which we are unable to move to 'In Progress'.  I have validated permissions and workflows.  The workflow in use is shared by 13 projects, we are only seeing this issue with 2 projects.  The symptom that is consistent, for the stories that we are unable to move, they all are showing a Resolved date and time which is the same as the created date and time, however the issue is NOT resolved.  It is an Open, unresolved status and there is no history to indicate that anyone had resolved and reopened these issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33767].
  {panel}

JIRA uses propertySet to limit the characters in some of the fields in JIRA, and in this case it limits the character limit to only 255. According to [AbstractPropertySet|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/opensymphony-propertyset/1.5/reference/com/opensymphony/module/propertyset/AbstractPropertySet.html], JIRA will throws {{IllegalPropertyException}} if value length greater than 255. The following is the error thrown
{noformat}2013-07-03 02:43:08,819 ajp-8009-3 ERROR HUFibinZ 163x5046x2 441cch 10.95.34.16,130.164.54.165 /secure/admin/NIEditHandlerDetails.jspa [plugins.mail.webwork.AbstractEditHandlerDetailsWebAction] Unable to add service: PO_FAX_SERVER
com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.IllegalPropertyException: String exceeds 255 characters.
        at com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.AbstractPropertySet.setString(AbstractPropertySet.java:297)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore.createPropertySet(OfBizServiceConfigStore.java:283)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore.editServiceConfig(OfBizServiceConfigStore.java:89)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.DefaultServiceManager.editService(DefaultServiceManager.java:235)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.webwork.AbstractEditHandlerDetailsWebAction.doExecute(AbstractEditHandlerDetailsWebAction.java:169)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165){noformat}

The expectation is to have JIRA handles it better to avoid exception from happening. JIRA has {{entitymodel}} to create the field length in the database, perhaps this could be the configuration it refers to instead. With that, the {{setText}} method can be used instead of {{setString}} method for the {{AbstractPropertySet}} class.
fields.summary: Avoid exception thrown by PropertySet class
View application properties page does not display the end-user i18n message for the Indexing Language setting
The JIRA setup wizard fails to set an indexing language when the user does not change the default locale
Set the correct indexing language for all bundled language packs
Upgrade to latest JSU in OD - 1.4.7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33758].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a screen with two tabs: "Field Tab" and "Tab 2"
* On the "Field Tab", leave all the default JIRA fields and add one custom field
* On "Tab 2", add another custom field

If you fill the custom fields on both tabs, both tabs will be displayed on the "View Issue Screen", however, if you leave the custom fields empty on one of the tabs, no tabs are displayed, and the custom field will be placed on the Details section of the View Issue Screen.
fields.summary: Display screen tabs on the view issue screen even if they contain no content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33739].
  {panel}

As an administrator, I would like to be able to select the level of stemming that is applied when JIRA indexes documents in the English language to be able to improve the relevance of query results according to the nature of the content stored in the index.

The set of options would be:

* English - Aggresive Stemming. (Current Strategy)
* English - Moderate Stemming.
* English - Minimal Stemming.
fields.summary: Stemming options for indexing in the english language

{noformat}

Each message represents 986 bytes of error logs and this means that we are creating about 1Kb every single time we get this exception and we create thousands of them. So this is about a 1Mb log penalty every single time that this happens: although it is only in he mail handler logs I think it should still be fixed.

My suggested fix is that, if you notice this exception, stop processing email. The folder is closed, you are not going to be able to read any more emails from this folder.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33708].
  {panel}

A customer has made the following request:

JIRA shouldn't allow you to attach files with the same name, at the same time without giving a warning or message at least. 

One justification is that the user is able to attach multiple copies of the very same file with a single action, and this is hardly necessary or useful.

Another related issue with this is that, in the case where this file has been modified outside JIRA, it may not be possible to tell the different files apart within JIRA because they can be attached with the same file name, as JIRA doesn't enforce a rename in this case.

*how to reproduce current behavior:*
Try to attach files to an issue in JIRA, you would find that you are able to select the very same file again and again and succesfully add it to the issue with the same file name, within the same dialog.
fields.summary: JIRA shouldn't allow file attachment with the same name at the same time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33692].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Welcome!|borderColor=#333| titleBGColor=#efefef|bgColor=#fff}
Hi,

Welcome to the *testing program* for the new workflow functionality that we are currently building.

h3. What's going to happen

I'm going to update this JIRA issue every time we add new functionality or incorporate any feedback you have provided. There are no obligations to participate in this program - simply play with the feature and provide feedback whenever you like.

h3. What we are after

The team really loves it when we get feedback on what we're building. Whether it be good or bad, it allows us to improve the feature much more rapidly than we could without feedback.

There is a 'Got Feedback?' button in the top right hand corner of the page you are going to be using. If you could click that and send all feedback/bugs/problems etc through, it will be raised in one of our JIRA instances and we can manage it there. If that doesn't work for any reason, please email me. :)

h3. What you need to do

This is an interesting experiment on my part because we are using one OnDemand instance, which you all have admin access to. Please be nice to one another and only play with workflows/projects/objects that you create.

Steps:
1. You will have been sent an email with credentials to an JIRA test instance - https://admin-feedback.jira-dev.com/ (your passwords are your usernames. Feel free to change them if you wish)
2. Create a workflow
3. Play around with the new designer functionality
4. Give us feedback!

Thanks in advance for any feedback or thoughts you have! 

Best Regards,
Josh
{panel}
\\{panel:title=Things that were in the old designer, but won't be implemented in the new designer|borderColor=#333| titleBGColor=#faacad|bgColor=#fff}
* Clone transition
* Annotations
{panel}
\\
{panel:title=Bugs that have been picked up by this program|borderColor=#333| titleBGColor=#009ACD|bgColor=#fff}
* Creating a status with a long name fails without a proper specification of why. I tried to give it a name of about 65k letters. Perhaps add a maxlength to the textbox?
* Sometimes when going into full screen mode, the tooltip is moved to the top leftmost part of the screen (see attached screenshot).
* FIXED -When I drag a status off the drawing area, the status stops at the edge of the drawing area. If I release the mouse button and move the mouse back onto the drawing area, the status follows me around.-
* If I can't add a new transition to a draft workflow, then the designer should know that and not let me do it graphically, then ask for name+description, before giving an error message.
* FIXED -it is possible to move the transition label "Create issue".-
* FIXED -When scrolling down the page, the workflow designer zooms (fix is in progress for this)-
* FIXED -You can add a status, but it is hard to find where it appeared unless you zoom way out-
* FIXED -When moving statuses, the cursor doesn't change to a "cross with arrows"-
* FIXED -"Create issue" transition can be moved-
* FIXED -Blue snap to object lines try to snap to everything (a fix is in progress for this :))-
{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33688].
  {panel}

(i) Note that this test was performed on a closed issue, and the Closed status contain the property to make the issue non-editable

When updating a closed issue using the SOAP method updateIssue, the process will fail with the following error:
{noformat}
Exception in thread "main" AxisFault
 faultCode: {http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Server.userException
 faultSubcode:
 faultString: com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteValidationException: Fields not valid for issue:
Errors: {}
Error Messages: [You do not have permission to edit issues in this project.]
 faultActor:
 faultNode:
 faultDetail:
        {}com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteException:null
        {http://xml.apache.org/axis/}hostname:afaisal-PC

com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteValidationException: Fields not valid for issue:
Errors: {}
Error Messages: [You do not have permission to edit issues in this project.]
        at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
[......]
{noformat}

The error message "You do not have permission to edit issues in this project" is correct, but the {{RemoteValidationException: Fields not valid for issue}} can be misleading. 

It will be great if we can update the error message so stating that the error occur because the issue is non-editable in Closed status.
fields.summary: Misleading error message appears if we try to update a closed issue using SOAP API (updateIssue)

...

  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Create SMTP mail Server
2. Setup POP/IMAP mail server and a *create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* mail handler and check the *CC Watchers* field
3. Send an email with the cc field to some other email address(which the user is register in JIRA) to the mail server and JIRA expectedly create a issue from it and added cc field email address into watchers of that issue.
4. After that, if continue to reply that email it will actually comment on that issue however if the cc field of the mail address is added some other email address, it won't add those email address as watchers.

h3. Customer expectation
The *CC Watchers* function should work even when user commenting on the exisiting issues that is created by the mail handler.
fields.summary: Creating Issues and Comments mail handler doesn't add CC fields to watcher on issue that is already created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33665].
  {panel}

There is this user who is having the following scenario in his JIRA instance, and wants a feature in JIRA that will enable the automation of such transition:
* The project manager will have a parent task including a lot of sub-tasks.
* Those sub-tasks will be assigned to different user groups, and will get notified once those sub-tasks are created.
* Those user groups will put all their comments on the sub-tasks assigned to them
* When the due-date comes, the project manager wants to gather all those comments by all user groups and output it into a seperated file.
fields.summary: Gather feedback and save it in a separated file
